channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Red & White Student Organization to Hold Info Session
item.description: Date: Thursday, January 16, 2025 6:00 PM - 6:30 PM - If you’re interested in joining the Red & White Student Organization, be sure to stop by room 3202 of the Student Union to learn what Red & White is and how the group is involved in our community, and how you can join!
item.author: Students

item.title: $5 Mayor’s Cup Tickets Available to RPI Students
item.description: A limited amount of specially-priced tickets for the 2025 Mayor’s Cup hockey game will be on sale to Rensselaer students at a table on the first floor of the Student Union from 9:30AM to 12:30PM this Tuesday and Thursday!
item.author: Students

item.title: Looking to Move into an Apartment?
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 14, 2025 5:00 PM - 6:00 PM - All students are welcome to attend this session to learn how to search for — and explore the considerations for selecting — an apartment, as well as get information on the resources that the Off-Campus Commons has to offer.
item.author: Students

item.title: Spring Wellness Wednesdays Kick Off January 15
item.description: Date: Wednesday, January 15, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - A program dedicated to enhancing student health and well-being, Wellness Wednesdays offer a diverse range of activities and information sessions that focus on crucial life skills and aim to equip students with practical knowledge for maintaining physical, mental, and financial wellness throughout their college journey and beyond.
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselyrics Spring Auditions to be Held January 14
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 14, 2025 8:00 PM - 10:30 PM - Enjoy singing gand making music? Audition for the Rensselyrics, RPI’s oldest, self-arranged and produced a cappella group! Sign up in advance, or simply walk-in at the Chapel + Cultural Center; we look forward to seeing you there!
item.author: Students

item.title: Select Collegiate Store Outerwear on Sale January 8-13
item.description: The Rensselaer Collegiate Store will have a sale on select outerwear from Wednesday, January 8, 2025 until Monday, January 13, when you can enjoy 20% off on select winter outerwear in the store and online. Come into the Store and see what you can save!
item.author: Community

item.title: Systems Engineering & Technology Management Review Scheduled for January 14
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 14, 2025 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Hosted by Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., this session focuses on Rensselaer’s flexible, project-based, online Systems Engineering and Technology Management graduate degree that will help prepare decision-makers with broader and deeper capabilities in leading dynamic organizations. Please register if you plan to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Forged by Fire” Event Highlights Story of the Pittsburgh Building
item.description: Date: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 7:00 PM - 8:15 PM - In honor of RPI’s Bicentennial Celebration, the Pittsburgh Alumni Chapter, led by Robert Douglass ’76, ’77G, has researched and captured the history of the Pittsburgh Building! Attend this virtually-hosted session to hear the motivation behind — and the enduring legacy of — the early Pittsburgh-based graduates who left an indelible gift to the students and spirit of the Institute. This event will also include a Q&A discussion.
item.author: Community

item.title: Don’t Miss the Mayor’s Cup Alumni and Fan Reception!
item.description: Date: Saturday, January 25, 2025 3:00 PM - 8:00 PM - Join RPI alumni and hockey fans at a reception at the MVP Arena in Albany, as the men’s and women’s Engineers take on Union! The reception begins at 4:30 p.m. and includes complimentary snacks, a cash bar, and remarks from Athletics staff; there is no charge to attend the reception, but you must purchase your own game ticket through the MVP Box Office.
item.author: Community

item.title: Arch Away Semester Reflection to be Held January 29
item.description: Join the CCPD, OUE, and Student Success on Wednesday, January 29 from 4pm to 6pm in DCC 318 to celebrate and reflect on students’ arch away experience from Spring, Summer, or Fall 2024! If your arch away experience is approaching, attend to hear from other students about what they did and how it benefitted them. Faculty and staff are also encouraged to attend!
item.author: Community

item.title: EMPAC Announces Spring 2025 Programs
item.description: Tickets and reservations are now available for all EMPAC events scheduled through May 2! Each of the 16 presentations offers a singular opportunity to connect with artists whose current works are pushing the boundaries of dance/theater, music/sound, film, and time-based visual arts.
item.author: Community

item.title: January 13 Session to Offer Instructor/TA Training for Fall 2024 End-of-Term Student Course Evaluation Results
item.description: Date: Monday, January 13, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - This webinar is for instructors and TAs who would like to better understand — or get a refresher course in — the various ways they can review their student course evaluations in HelioCampus.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: HR to Hold Professional Development Seminar, “Developing Your Leadership Presence”
item.description: Date: Wednesday, January 15, 2025 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This seminar is designed to help leaders improve their ability to authentically influence and connect with others by striking a balance between strength and warmth. Discussion topics include the relationship between personal presence and ability to influence people and situations, how specific behaviors increase or decrease an influential presence, and steps to authentically interact with others in a more influential manner.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Last Call: HelioCampus Virtual Syllabus Assistance Being Offered January 17
item.description:
Date: Friday, January 17, 2025 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Per requirements from the Provost’s office, faculty should have their syllabi published in HelioCampus by January 20, 2025. Those needing HelioCampus syllabus assistance may contact Learning Assessment Specialist Amy Svirsky.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
